I'm happy to help you find a dance studio that offers Zumba classes! However, I have to clarify that I'm a large language model, I don't have personal experiences or real-time information about specific dance studios or events. But I can provide you with some general tips on how to find a Zumba studio in your city.

1. Online Search: You can search for "Zumba classes near me" or "Zumba studios in [your city]" on search engines like Google. This should give you a list of nearby studios that offer Zumba classes.
2. Zumba Website: You can also visit the official Zumba website ([www.zumba.com](http://www.zumba.com)) and use their "Find a Class" feature to search for Zumba classes in your area.
3. Social Media: Check social media platforms like Facebook or Instagram to find local dance studios that offer Zumba classes. You can search for hashtags like #Zumba or #ZumbaClass to find relevant posts.
4. Ask Friends or Family: Ask your friends, family, or coworkers if they know of any good Zumba studios in the area. Word of mouth is a great way to find a studio that's a good fit for you.

As for your recent Zumba event on March 17th, that's great to hear that you had fun! Was it a one-time event or a regular class? If you liked the instructor or the studio, you might want to consider taking more classes with them.

Remember to always check the studio's schedule, pricing, and reviews before committing to a class. It's essential to find a studio that fits your schedule, budget, and dance style. Happy dancing!
